intro: Cyrtandra aloisiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-violet flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and is often found in the understory of native Hawaiian forests. Cyrtandra aloisiana has lance-shaped leaves and is known for its ornamental value. It is also an important species in the ecological balance of its native habitat.
